intro: Anemone narcissiflora var. speciosa, commonly known as the showy anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It features showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and are borne on upright stems. The plant has palmately divided, lobed leaves that are typically hairy and have a rough texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking ornamental plants with a native look.
